properties.name: 3 Bags Full
properties.description: Posted by Tpang  56, Nicholson St, Abbotsford, VIC AustraliaA hidden treasure tucked into a rehashed warehouse PLUS a hot, cute redhead waitress. Oh, and there\'s some serious coffee being served at this modernesque interpretation of a coffee house. Your choice of kooky left or right-turn designs on your bum at the long shared table. The 4 seats pushed into the corner give you court-side seats to the busy barristas working the 4 bean grinding machines and spitting out fine grains to yield smooth brews that coat your mouth and tongue with alluring flavours. The granola trifle was very filling for a sunday morning, and the brownies are the temptation for a return visit. Awesome chic place to be! Check out a write-up about this place prior to its opening: http://www.fivesensescoffee.com.au/news/2010/01/11/three-bags-full

properties.name: Ajisen Ramen
properties.description: Posted by Tpang 130 Bourke St, VIC 3000

properties.name: Auction Rooms Cafe
properties.description: Posted by Tpang 103-104 Errol St, North Melbourne, VICJan 23rd 2010: An early weekend morning before the morning crowd calls for a hearty breakfast as a reward for the early wake-up. An opening bid and a counter bid at auction rooms will see you well through till afternoon tea-time. And the coffee isn\'t too bad either.

properties.name: Babka Bakery Cafe
properties.description: Posted by Tpang 358 Brunswick St Fitzroy VIC 3065358 Brunswick St Fitzroy VIC 3065 Tel: (03) 9416 0091 Open Tue-Sun 7am-7pm The moment you step in, this warmly place takes you in. Stuffy and warm on this sunny Sunday morning, but the pretty waitresses more than make up for this. Oh, did I mention the smell of freshly baked confectionery perpetually wafted in the air? This Russian institute along Brunswick St has had its well-deserved coverage over the years. Go early to avoid any wait, ~8am and no later than 9am. No worries having spare time in hand, some well-brewed coffee will help pass your newspaper time. Fluffy croissants with cherry compote or orange jam, neither too buttery nor too soft. A solid veal sausage roll for .50 served with home-made tomato condiment. Gotta head back to try some of that authentic yummy borscht!

properties.name: Cutler & Co. Dining Room and Bar
properties.description: Posted by Tpang 55-57 Gertrude St, Fitzroy VIC 3065, Melbourne AustraliaCutler & Co. (Andrew McConnell) 55-57 Gertrude St, Fitzroy VIC 3065 +61 3 9419 4888 Lunch: Friday & Sunday from 12 noon Dinner: Tuesday to Sunday from 6pm Bar: Tuesday to Sunday 4pm to midnight Bar Oysters .50-4.50 each Small eats ~-15 To share: steamed pork buns 2 Jamon Iberico de Bellota (40gms) 2 Variety of beers on tap, aperitif and wines Dining Room Entree ~0 Mains ~0-40 Large meats 00-140 Sides (only 2 available) Desserts ~7 Jan 28th 2010: A very disappointing visit this time, having discovered a bar menu that has the pork hock missing, but also with a substantial portion (about half) of the previously offered small eats missing. Have to think trice about a return visit.

properties.name: Dumplings Plus
properties.description: Posted by Tpang 269 Swanston St, VIC 3000, AustraliaOk, so you\'re wandering around in the city hungry. It\'s not too late but sufficiently dark enough not to want to walk into a proper sit-down restaurant. And you don\'t have much cash left. Want a casual place? Try Dumplings Plus. Don\'t worry, no fears and risk of food poisoning, this is no Shanghai Dumpling (Cammy\'s). Right along Swanston St, pick any of the dumplings on the first page of their menu and you\'re stomach will be filled good. Try the lamb wrap, or the red bean pancake to finish. They make a mean bowl of noodles, as well as a stir-fry 年糕. They do dishes as well, but I have yet to try them. Stick with the tried and tested dumplings which I give one thumb up. Cheap and reliable with no sweat.

properties.name: Embrasse
properties.description: Posted by Tpang 312 Drummond St, VIC 3053, AustraliaEx-312 Drummond (Andrew McConnell), this is the replacement establishment by French owner/chef Nicholas Poelaert. The restaurant is small, quaint and well-lit with a touch of class. Sunday Brunch from 0930 to 2pm offers a versatile range from scrambled eggs with cured baconand black pudding to a more luxurious wagyu cut.

properties.name: Flower Drum Restaurant
properties.description: Posted by Tpang 17 Market Lane, VIC 3000, Australia

properties.name: Grigons and Orr
properties.description: Posted by Tpang 445 Quuensberry St North Melbourne, VIC30th Jan 2010: The nearest brekkie outpost within my apt\'s proximity that\'s never empty on a weekday let alone a weekend. The cappuccino and flat white is flavoursome, along with the strawberry or cucumber flavoured water for the table. The scrambled eggs on toast was healthy in portion, but the poached eggs were way over done. Bit of mushroom and bacon on the side brings the bill to about 8 ppax.

properties.name: Honey

properties.name: Hutong Dumpling Bar
properties.description: Posted by Tpang 14-16 Market Lane, VIC, Australia24th Jan This little eatery is on Market Lane right across the doors of the omnipresent Flower Drum. I was sufficiently impressed on my introductory lunch to have this pop into my mind when called for an early Sunday evening dinner. I\'d recommend calling ahead for a reservation as there are more potential diners than there are seats. This return visit was initially marked by by the nonchalant attitude of a single waiter who decided that 2 menus were sufficient for 4 separate diners on a share table. We decided that walking up and grabbing the menus ourselves were quicker. On this occasion, I over-ruled by annoyance and heeded my hunger by ordering the unmissable 小龙包. The skin wasn\'t too thin such that it broke when you picked it up, it was of a consistent thickness, and steamed almost to perfection with juicy minced pork and tasty juices inside. On the down-side, the vinegar and ginger condiment was paltry and you\'d probably need to ask for 3x the served amount. Passing on the pan-fried 锅帖 on this occasion, the 云吞 in chilli dressing did not disappoint. Afterwhich, we had mapo tofu and black-pepper beef slice stir-fry with rice, the former being quite generous in portion. This place isn\'t associated with the price one would attached to dumpling houses. However, you get what you pay for in terms of non-greasy, more refined cooking. Perhaps the greatly-needing-improvement service and the cramped spacing provides some element of the traditional Cammy\'s styled dumpling eatery. Gotta have some bad to go with the good.

properties.name: Laksa King
properties.description: Posted by Tpang 320 Racecourse Rd, Flemington, VICIf you want decently priced Laksa and/or Malaysian food, then Laksa King is the place to drop-by. Always a crowd during dinner time, they also do takeaways. I wish this place stayed open beyond 10pm. Bring your expectations of a slightly crowded, noisy with chit-chat and family bustle typical of an Asian food outlet and have a great dinner.

properties.name: Sosta Cucina
properties.description: Posted by Tpang 12 Errol St, North Melbourne, VIC 3051, AustraliaAn inconspicuous Italian restaurant along Errol St which could so easily be missed as you walk by. Very friendly service and good, solid cooking to boot. Doesn\'t try to punch above its weight. Very popular with the faithful crowd and consistently booked out on Fri and weekends.
